title: Real and complex number postulates restated as axioms

blocks.name: ax-cnex
blocks.content: The complex numbers form a set. This axiom is redundant - see ~ cnexALT - but we provide this axiom because the justification theorem ~ axcnex does not use ~ ax-rep even though the redundancy proof does. Proofs should normally use ~ cnex instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 1-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-resscn
blocks.content: The real numbers are a subset of the complex numbers. Axiom 1 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axresscn . (Contributed by NM, 1-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-1cn
blocks.content: 1 is a complex number. Axiom 2 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ ax1cn . (Contributed by NM, 1-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-icn
blocks.content: ` _i ` is a complex number. Axiom 3 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axicn . (Contributed by NM, 1-Mar-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-addcl
blocks.content: Closure law for addition of complex numbers. Axiom 4 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axaddcl . Proofs should normally use ~ addcl instead, which asserts the same thing but follows our naming conventions for closures. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-addrcl
blocks.content: Closure law for addition in the real subfield of complex numbers. Axiom 6 of 23 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axaddrcl . Proofs should normally use ~ readdcl instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-mulcl
blocks.content: Closure law for multiplication of complex numbers. Axiom 6 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axmulcl . Proofs should normally use ~ mulcl instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-mulrcl
blocks.content: Closure law for multiplication in the real subfield of complex numbers. Axiom 7 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axmulrcl . Proofs should normally use ~ remulcl instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-mulcom
blocks.content: Multiplication of complex numbers is commutative. Axiom 8 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axmulcom . Proofs should normally use ~ mulcom instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-addass
blocks.content: Addition of complex numbers is associative. Axiom 9 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axaddass . Proofs should normally use ~ addass instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-mulass
blocks.content: Multiplication of complex numbers is associative. Axiom 10 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axmulass . Proofs should normally use ~ mulass instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-distr
blocks.content: Distributive law for complex numbers (left-distributivity). Axiom 11 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axdistr . Proofs should normally use ~ adddi instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: ax-i2m1
blocks.content: i-squared equals -1 (expressed as i-squared plus 1 is 0). Axiom 12 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axi2m1 . (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-1ne0
blocks.content: 1 and 0 are distinct. Axiom 13 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ ax1ne0 . (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-1rid
blocks.content: ` 1 ` is an identity element for real multiplication. Axiom 14 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ ax1rid . Weakened from the original axiom in the form of statement in ~ mulid1 , based on ideas by Eric Schmidt. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-1995.)

blocks.name: ax-rnegex
blocks.content: Existence of negative of real number. Axiom 15 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axrnegex . (Contributed by Eric Schmidt, 21-May-2007.)

blocks.name: ax-rrecex
blocks.content: Existence of reciprocal of nonzero real number. Axiom 16 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axrrecex . (Contributed by Eric Schmidt, 11-Apr-2007.)

blocks.name: ax-cnre
blocks.content: A complex number can be expressed in terms of two reals. Definition 10-1.1(v) of [Gleason] p. 130. Axiom 17 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axcnre . For naming consistency, use ~ cnre for new proofs. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 9-May-1999.)

blocks.name: ax-pre-lttri
blocks.content: Ordering on reals satisfies strict trichotomy. Axiom 18 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axpre-lttri . Note: The more general version for extended reals is ~ axlttri . Normally new proofs would use ~ xrlttri . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2005.)

blocks.name: ax-pre-lttrn
blocks.content: Ordering on reals is transitive. Axiom 19 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axpre-lttrn . Note: The more general version for extended reals is ~ axlttrn . Normally new proofs would use ~ lttr . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2005.)

blocks.name: ax-pre-ltadd
blocks.content: Ordering property of addition on reals. Axiom 20 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axpre-ltadd . Normally new proofs would use ~ axltadd . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2005.)

blocks.name: ax-pre-mulgt0
blocks.content: The product of two positive reals is positive. Axiom 21 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axpre-mulgt0 . Normally new proofs would use ~ axmulgt0 . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2005.)

blocks.name: ax-pre-sup
blocks.content: A nonempty, bounded-above set of reals has a supremum. Axiom 22 of 22 for real and complex numbers, justified by theorem ~ axpre-sup . Note: Normally new proofs would use ~ axsup . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2005.)
blocks.origin:
axiom ax-pre-sup(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s1), cltrr, cv(s0))))), wrex(s0, cr, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s0), cltrr, cv(s1)))), wral(s1, cr, wi(wbr(cv(s1), cltrr, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s1), cltrr, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom ax-pre-sup(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚äÜ ‚Ñù ‚àß c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñù, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, s1[<]s0)))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñù,(‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ¬¨ s0[<]s1)‚àß ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà ‚Ñù,(s1[<]s0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s2 ‚àà c0, s1[<]s2))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
}

blocks.name: ax-addf
blocks.content: Addition is an operation on the complex numbers. This deprecated axiom is provided for historical compatibility but is not a bona fide axiom for complex numbers (independent of set theory) since it cannot be interpreted as a first- or second-order statement (see ~ http://us.metamath.org/downloads/schmidt-cnaxioms.pdf ). It may be deleted in the future and should be avoided for new theorems. Instead, the less specific ~ addcl should be used. Note that uses of ~ ax-addf can be eliminated by using the defined operation ` ( x e. CC , y e. CC |-> ( x + y ) ) ` in place of ` + ` , from which this axiom (with the defined operation in place of ` + ` ) follows as a theorem. This axiom is justified by theorem ~ axaddf . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: ax-mulf
blocks.content: Multiplication is an operation on the complex numbers. This deprecated axiom is provided for historical compatibility but is not a bona fide axiom for complex numbers (independent of set theory) since it cannot be interpreted as a first- or second-order statement (see ~ http://us.metamath.org/downloads/schmidt-cnaxioms.pdf ). It may be deleted in the future and should be avoided for new theorems. Instead, the less specific ~ ax-mulcl should be used. Note that uses of ~ ax-mulf can be eliminated by using the defined operation ` ( x e. CC , y e. CC |-> ( x x. y ) ) ` in place of ` x. ` , from which this axiom (with the defined operation in place of ` x. ` ) follows as a theorem. This axiom is justified by theorem ~ axmulf . (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-2004.)
